name: Titanium.Filesystem.File
summary: Object representing a path to a file or directory in the device's persistent storage.

methods.name: append
methods.summary: Appends data to the file identified by this file object.
methods.description:
Data to append can be specified as a String, Blob, or File.

If the data argument is a File object, the file's contents are appended to this file.

Returns true if the operation succeeds.

methods.name: copy
methods.summary: Copies the file identified by this file object to a new path.

methods.name: createdAt
methods.summary: Returns the creation Date for the file identified by this file object.
methods.description: On Android, returns a Date whose getTime() value is 0 for resource files.

methods.name: createDirectory
methods.summary: Creates a directory at the path identified by this file object.
methods.description: Returns true if the directory was created successfully.

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.summary: Toggles whether to recursively create the directory structure (like mkdir -p). Pass false to avoid recursively creating the directory. Defaults to true on SDK 7.3.0+, defaults to false on older SDK versions.

methods.name: createFile
methods.summary: Creates a file at the path identified by this file object.
methods.description:
Note that if you write to a file that doesn't exist, the file is created automatically, so it is not necessary to call this method unless you want to explicitly create the file (for example, to create an empty file).

Returns true if the file was created successfully. Returns false if the file already exists, or if the file couldn't be created for some other reason.

methods.name: createTimestamp
methods.summary: Returns the creation timestamp for the file identified by this file object.

methods.name: deleteDirectory
methods.summary: Deletes the directory identified by this file object.
methods.description: Returns true if the operation was successful. Does nothing if the file object does not identify a directory.

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.summary: Pass true to recursively delete any directory contents.

methods.name: deleteFile
methods.summary: Deletes the file identified by this file object.

methods.name: exists
methods.summary: Returns true if the file or directory identified by this file object exists on the device.

methods.name: extension
methods.summary: Returns the extension for the file identified by this file object.

methods.name: getDirectoryListing
methods.summary: Returns a listing of the directory identified by this file object, or null if this object doesn't identify a directory.

methods.name: getParent

deprecated.notes: Use the parent property to receive a File reference instead. If you wish to receive the path, use the nativePath property of that reference instead.

methods.summary: Returns the path of the parent directory holding the file identified by this file object, as a String (deprecated) or as a File object.
methods.description: Prior to Titanium SDK 7.0.0, on iOS this method returned the path of the parent directory as a String. Since Titanium SDK 7.0.0, this method has been deprecated in favor of the parent property and will return a Titanium.Filesystem.File reference in the future as well.

returns.summary: Returns a String on iOS, a Titanium.Filesystem.File on Android

methods.name: getProtectionKey
methods.summary: Returns the protection key value of this file object. Returns null if there's an error.

methods.name: isDirectory
methods.summary: Returns true if this file object represents a directory.

methods.name: isFile
methods.summary: Returns true if this file object represents an ordinary file.

methods.name: modificationTimestamp
methods.summary: Returns the last modification time for this file.

methods.name: modifiedAt
methods.summary: Returns the last modification Date for the file identified by this file object.
methods.description: On Android, returns a Date whose getTime() value is 0 for resource files.

methods.name: move
methods.summary: Moves the file identified by this file object to another path.
methods.description: Note that this method moves the stored file, but doesn't update this file object to point to the new path. To access the file after moving it, you must call getFile using the destination path to obtain a new file handle.

methods.name: open
methods.summary: Opens the file identified by this file object for random access.
methods.description:
You can open the file for reading, writing, or appending by specifying one of the MODE constants from Titanium.Filesystem: MODE_READ, MODE_WRITE, or MODE_APPEND.

The FileStream object returned by this call can be used to read from, write to, or append to the file, depending on what mode the file is opened in.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.summary: Mode to open the file in: MODE_READ, MODE_WRITE, or MODE_APPEND.

methods.name: read
methods.summary: Returns the contents of the file identified by this file object as a Blob.

methods.name: rename
methods.summary: Renames the file identified by this file object.
methods.description:
Returns true if the file was successfully renamed.

Fails if the destination is in a different directory than the current file. Use move to move a file to a different directory.

Note that this method renames the stored file, but doesn't update this file object to point to the new path. To access the file after renaming it, you must call getFile using the destination path to obtain a new file handle.

methods.name: resolve
methods.summary: Returns the fully-resolved native path associated with this file object.
methods.description:
On iOS, the path returned by this method is a plain file path, not a URL. It is suitable for use in native modules that need to access the file using native APIs.

On Android, the return value of resolve is a file:// URL, identical to the nativePath property.

methods.name: setProtectionKey
methods.summary: Sets the protection key as an attribute to the file identified by this file object.
methods.description: Returns true if successfully set. Returns false if failed.

methods.name: spaceAvailable
methods.summary: Returns the amount of free space available on the device where the file identified by this file object is stored.

methods.name: write
methods.summary: Writes the specified data to the file identified by this file object.
methods.description:
If the append parameter is false or not specified, any existing data in the file is overwritten.

If append is true, the specified data is appended to the end of the file.

parameters.name: data
parameters.summary: Data to write, as a String, Blob or File object.

parameters.name: append
parameters.summary: If true, append the data to the end of the file.

properties.name: executable
properties.description: On iOS, this property exists but is always false.

properties.name: hidden
properties.summary: Set to true if the file is hidden.
properties.description: On iOS, this property exists but is always false.

properties.name: nativePath
properties.summary: Native path associated with this file object, as a file URL.
properties.description: On iOS, use the resolve method to obtain a plain file path for use with native modules.

properties.name: parent
properties.summary: A File object representing the parent directory of the file identified by this object.
properties.description: iOS platform-note: Prior to Titanium SDK 7.0.0, this method returned the path of the parent directory as a String. Since Titanium SDK 7.0.0 it returnes a Titanium.Filesystem.File reference for parity wih Android and Windows.

properties.name: readonly
properties.summary: true if the file identified by this object is read-only.

properties.name: remoteBackup
properties.summary: Value indicating whether or not to back up to a cloud service.
properties.description:
Some apps may be rejected by Apple for backing up specific files; if this is the case, ensure that this value is set to false for them. This value should only need to be set once by your app, but setting it multiple times will not cause problems. For files distributed with your app, this will need to be set on boot. This flag will only affect iOS versions 5.0.1 and later, but is safe to set on earlier versions.

Note that setting this property to false will also prevent the file identified by this object from being backed up to iTunes.

properties.name: size
properties.summary: Size, in bytes, of the file identified by this object.

properties.name: symbolicLink
properties.summary: true if the file identified by this object is a symbolic link.

properties.name: writable
properties.summary: true if the file identified by this object is writable.
